stories.text:
I know you cant change PDF but there are tons of websites that can turn PDF to Word. So what Even makes PDF protected any more If I can turn it, edit it and turn back it to PDF?

This opens so many cans of worms + im super interested how the so called protection works.
stories.title: Ask HN: How Are PDFs Protected?

stories.text:
My name is Mike Gabriel and I am a senior technical recruiter. I'm posting to reach an audience of experienced software and development engineering professionals with at least 5+ years of experience to fill several 100% remote positions.

I am representing a financially secure, stable, revenue generating, profitable, and fast growing pre-IPO SaaS-based financial services company.

The company is hiring across all levels of engineering from mid to senior to manager to director.

Contact me if you have at least 5+ years of professional work experience and the following expertise:

BACKEND: APIs - API Development with Python and Flask in a Google Compute and AWS environment.

FRONTEND: Javascript Vue.js ECMAS 6 Git HTML5 CSS3 React

Additional: JAVA, API Development, Frontend Engineering, Backend Engineering, Scalable APIs, Functional APIs, High Availability.

About the jobs: 100% remote jobs (no travel requirements), Company pays 100% of healthcare for the employee and their family, Base salary plus sign on bonus possible, Bonuses based on performance, pre-IPO stocks, vacation and time off, 401k etc, much more amenities.

Available contract, contract to hire, Direct Hire. Contact Mike Gabriel.

Connect with me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabrielatzenith/

Email Resumes to: gabe (at) zenithsgp (dot) com
stories.title: Hiring Remote Front End and Back End Software Engineers

stories.text:
If I'm not supposed to post here regarding advice - please do direct me to the right forum - apologies for any inconvenience caused

Hi all,

I'm a founder at a Singaporean startup - we are a semi-technical team that is trying to change the way benefits and employment works.

In a short one liner - We are building a B2B platform for insurance and pension benefits for the Gig-Economy.

We're trying to deploy this asap so that contingent and platform workers (Grab/GoJek/Deliveroo/UpWork) can recieve platform benefits and have a safety net to build savings/insurance coverage and a whole host of portable benefits - keeping them safe, secure and most of all satisfied.

Our biggest hurdle now is building a tech team without funding... I understand that funding is not the be all/end all of the company, however, currently all we have are state sponsored grants and they're running out quick. Moreover, most bulge brackets and startups have kind of a monopoly on tech teams at this point and inticing someone without cash here is next to impossible.

We were considering applying for specific incubators within pension-tech and insuretech in order to build the team and resources, however, Singapore is quite limited in that space. We could also consider partnering with larger firms at the cost of giving up a lot of the company (which we are ok with) as the first and last thing we want is to give these platform workers peace of mind.Tldr - we're in a bit of a predicament.

What are your thoughts - any advice would be greatly appreciated.
stories.title: Singapore Startup â€“ Need Advice
